page.title: 01Communications to Gourdon
page.content: The tourist or visitor should have no difficulty in getting to Gourdon. This picturesque village well worth a visit lies just below the main A92 trunk road midway between Stonehaven and Montrose. The only access road for motor vehicles leaves the main road at "The Latch" just south of Inverbervie and Sillyflatt Farm. Once past the parish cemetery and Boath Park (gifted to the people of Gourdon by ex-Provost D.C. Boath in 1926) the road soon begins to climb steeply down to the rather snug and secure looking harbour area and onto William Street which was at one time the only street in the village. Many closes in this part of the village are well worth exploring for those who may be interested in old fishing communities.
